newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin dips on LME but volume up on weak ringgit.
newsitem.headline: KL tin dips on LME but volume up on weak ringgit.

text.p: Malaysia's spot tin price dipped two cents to 13.77 ringgit ($5.30) a kg on Friday due to an overnight fall on the London Metal Exchange, traders said.
But buying volumes increased due to the ringgit's sharp fall recently against the U.S. dollar, which made Malaysian tin an attractive buy, said the traders.
"The LME was down sharply, so we followed," said a trader. "But there was also some good buying, mainly from the Japanese, who were attracted to the cheaper value of tin now because of the ringgit."
The closing price was at par with LME on Tuesday.
Traders noted initial bids for 74 tonnes against offers for 126. Final turnover was 116 tonnes, against 71 on Wednesday, and was absorbed by Europeans, Japanese and locals.
Traders said the resistance level for the market was currently seen at 14 ringgit.
